website_summaries.verdict: Geared towards guitarists, this interface offers simplicity and an extensive software package that works for Mac and PC.
pros: Comes in a variety of sizes and configurations
Works with Windows, Mac, and Linux
Features a Scarlett mic preamp, an instrument/guitar input, and stereo line outputs
Software package includes Pro Tools and a variety of plug-ins and samples
cons: Works well with a Mac, but the PC drivers leave a bit to be desired
Some found that the audio quality can be spotty with this option

customer_reviews.title: Works great. And comes with great software
customer_reviews.text: This works so well. The only problem is that sometimes you have to unplug it and plug it back in of your computer goes to sleep. But that's not a huge problem. It also comes with a ton of free plugins that I now use all the time. Definitely worth 100 dollars
customer_reviews.author: Luke Branson

customer_reviews.title: Worthy Buy Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: big improvement from on board sound very crisp and clear good volume for headphones great buy for $100 really makes a difference will never go back to on board sound again only one thing i just wish avid hurry up and upgrade protools first for windows 10 not really a ableton guy Tip (Update) : to Get Pro Tools | First to run on windows10 if you getting that 6117 error just got into your playback and recording setting and disable everything then restart Pro Tools | First will ask you about what sound device you are using then Make Sure You have the Focusrite ASIO Driver Installed Not The ASIO4ALL Driver r
customer_reviews.author: blaqsheep580

customer_reviews.title: Too much hassle, customer service is slow
customer_reviews.text: The first few months with this were good, no issues setting it up, but after that I kept getting people telling me they hear fuzzing sounds through my mic and my voice sounding robot like, which was fixes with plugging it out and back in, but then it completely wouldn't turn on. Focusrite support sent me a new cable which fixed the issue, but then it happened again a month later and they stopped answering my emails, even though I opened up a new ticket. Kind of ridiculous, I should have gotten an audio interface from another company honestly, way too much hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome when it worked, didn't work for long.
customer_reviews.text: Finally pulled the trigger on the Solo and a AT2035 after wanting this setup for a long time. Packages came in today, and they were set up no problem. Around 3 hours after I set everything up i got 3 loud pops back to back and the unit turned off and the USB male end was hot to the touch. Couldn't get the unit to power back on, 2 different cables, 2 PC's; all USB ports on both. Nothing. Will be RMA'ing this to see if maybe I just got unlucky and got a dud, and will update the review based on my experience with the new unit...
customer_reviews.author: Amy Richard

customer_reviews.title: CAN'T DOWNLOAD WITHOUT ENOUGH MEMORY
customer_reviews.text: Yes Folks, after ten hours of attempting downloads of the free software I ended up getting the SAME Downloads from the NET for free. THEY WORKED because they did not have the tons of advertisements that Focusrite tags on. During this insanity my efforts with their HELPLINE proved worthless because I do not speak Filippino. After clearing my computer, the FOCUSRITE WORKS LIKE A CHAMP WITH THE NET's DOWNLOAD of AUDACITY. I'm very happy and satisfied. (NOTE: THE FOCUSRITE MUST HAVE EARPHONES for listening. It does NOT use the computer speakers.) HIGHLY RECOMMENDED by someone who never even walked in to a Recording Studio.
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: New Drivers Ruin Computers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my Focusrite iTrack Solo, and that was a mistake. While the iTrack worked as a piece of hardware and required little to no installation, the Scarlett Solo required a driver to be installed. This driver caused a lot of problems to my computer and usually didn't work properly. "Did you install the right driver?" Yeah I did. I checked and it was the only one that matched my criteria, but even then, who cares? Why did this need a driver when the iTrack didn't? Quit these garbage improvements and make hardware that works smoothly. Anyway, I'm giving it three stars because I assume it works for other people, just not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Dallin Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Change of heart! After returning a defective one the new one I received works like a DREAM!!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought all the interfaces on amazon in this price range and there is no competition. This one is the best Hands down! First one I received had latency and im assuming driver/firmware issues, after returning it and re buying in giving it a second chance I have had absolutely no issues. Works like a DREAM. It is hard to believe that such an inexpensive interface can put out such great quality! Thank you focusrite! I highly recommend this interface.
customer_reviews.author: iris

customer_reviews.title: Hope you have a 1/8 to 1/4 Phono adapter
customer_reviews.text: You would think, since so much, even a computer, is made with 1/8 jacks that they would have some mercy and put a 1/8 jack on this thing or at least throw in a $5 1/8 to phono adapter. This is my first ASIO device, and I spent days trying to figure out how to hear anything from ableton or any other program, so I could, you know, hear the instruments while I tried to sing along? You cannot have ASIO input and MME output as far as I can tell. So you're screwed if you don't have a phono jack. Wow. So much customer hate could be fixed with a 1/8 jack or adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Frumious Bandersnatch

customer_reviews.title: Worked for about 4 months of occasional use
customer_reviews.text: Worked for about 4 months of occasional use, now it produces a loud crackling noise unless its turned down too low to use. Had to replace it with a mixer.. should've went the more expensive way the first time I guess. After replacing with the mixer the audio was clean which proves the issue was this focusrite.
customer_reviews.author: Greg M

customer_reviews.title: Software issues with windows 10
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with Studio 1 and windows 10 - worked OK for one day, then wouldn't connect or disconnected in the middle of recording every 15 seconds. Not worth a penny. Get the software issues figured out before bringing something to market or don't market it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Groves

customer_reviews.title: Just didn’t get it to work
customer_reviews.text: First off I will tell you I never did get it to work. It never worked with any computer. I am usually pretty savvy with this kind of hardware and software and have used other products like this. In my opinion this is overly complicated from the unending registration hoops to jump through all the way down to just trying to get it to do something. Anything. Changed all kinds of setting for playback and record just to keep getting frustrated. I do not recommend this for a first timer trying to do home recording.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the most recent version
customer_reviews.text: This is fine, but it's a 2nd Generation version and they're currently on the 3rd Gen for the same price. I ordered by mistake, in that I wanted a 3rd Gen, but it's not really worth the hassle to return it and I need it this weekend, so I'll keep this one. I know I could have paid more attention. That's on me. And the product itself is fantastic. As there are so many versions of these Scarlett audio interfaces between the different models, different packages, and different generations, just be careful!
customer_reviews.author: TunaDonut

customer_reviews.title: How To Fix Home Recording Problems?
customer_reviews.text: The Focusrite Scarlett Solo (2nd Gen) USB Audio is as advertised! after reading the manual and hooking it up (which was as simple as pie), I finally came to realize that this unit was the missing piece to my home recording puzzle. I only gave it 5 stars because they didn't have 6!!! If you are a musician interested on creating a home recording studio that is very "portable" I highly recommend this unit!!!
customer_reviews.author: David J. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: After installing the official drivers I lose all under 192kh but I gained asio. I'm not sure why they did this but it would have been nice to retain those lower rates to save some CPU when I simply don't need the resolution. The inputs are not split. Instead they come in has a stereo signal with the XLR connector coming in on the Left Channel and the instrument input on the right Channel. You can select a mixed mono which is a nice feature but I would have preferred two separate mono inputs. The recordings are impressively clear and the output is among the better I have heard.
customer_reviews.author: TheTaLlesT

customer_reviews.title: Works Great with Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: I really like this interface and the software it comes with. Most important, I like that the interface works great with Windows 10; no driver issues! The interface provides a clean sound and works great with most recording programs. I have tried it out on Cubase and Ableton Live 10 and it works great! Definitely a great value and product!
customer_reviews.author: Jay G

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I own this audio interface and I use for professional purposes. 24Bit and up to 192KHZ, this little guy is amazing specially if you only need one mic input. I give 5 stars and recommend it. Now keep in mind that every audio interface has its own sound but this guy is incredible and way too nice quality for its price. Check how my productions sounds, subscribe to my YouTube Channel CwilliamMusic so you can hear what this baby can do.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar William Gonzalez Bueno

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding:  Produces good audio & easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: I do VO and need a quick, easy way to get content recorded. I recently upgraded my studio, and at the recommendation of an agency contact, purchased the Focusrite Scarlett Solo. It's simple, it works and sounds great. I just bought a second one for another studio. If you're looking for quick, easy and great sound get this box. Note: I previously used the MBox with Pro-Tools which is very good, but needed something to work with Adobe Audition. The Focusrite is as good as the M-Box.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: ... mic and/or guitar into this and connect to your favorite music making software
customer_reviews.text: Plug a mic and/or guitar into this and connect to your favorite music making software. 2 inputs, one for a mic and one for whatever you can connect with a 1/4 inch jack. Master volume and individual input volume knobs go red when your signal is too hot. I love that feature. This thing delivers what it promises for a great price. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Great product, very happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: Originally bought a Behringer interface. It was making me crazy since technical things kept popping up that I couldn't figure out. I heard that Focusrite was a good brand and easy to use so I got this one. It really is easier, small, nicer looking,( although that isn't why I bought it) Mostly, it does exactly what it is supposed to do, no muss no fuss. Sound quality is perfect and I expect to be using this device for many years to come. It also isn't so expensive that you have to worry about saving up to buy one. If you need an interface, this one should be on the top of your list.
customer_reviews.author: J.R. Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Best I have had yet!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best interface I have owed thus far. Especially for the money. The latency is pretty low, the sound quality is great and it is small so somewhat discrete. While I wish I had other color options, this thing is great and I would recommend it or its other platforms in a heartbeat. If you are looking for a cheap but worth wild option, this is it! If you buy right, it also comes with some pretty nice software too...
customer_reviews.author: IamTheBeatBoy

customer_reviews.title: The setup is painful, the application is confusing and the bottom line ...
customer_reviews.text: The setup is painful, the application is confusing and the bottom line is it takes a master's degree to figure this thing out, it's not plug and play by far. I have the unit installed and all the plugins and it's silent, I'm going to need to do research just to figure out how this thing records and how I can hear sound, right now it's silent and silence is not golden.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Wills

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Audio Distortion with Extended Use
customer_reviews.text: After an extended period of use (usually 4+ hours of constant playback, sometime less) terrible distortion starts in the audio. It wasn't gradual either, it just starts. Sometimes all it takes is stopping all audio sources, sometimes it is merely disabling the device and then re-enabling it and others I have to restart my entire computer. Tried two different units, from separate sellers even, and same issue. I had a 1st Gen and never had this issue. I see in other reviews, I'm not the only one with this issue. I'll just get a different Audio Interface referred by a friend.
customer_reviews.author: TrowGundam

customer_reviews.title: Horrible!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely horrible unit. I have tried this unit on 3 different computers, 2 different macs and a PC. All of them start off recording fine but then you keep getting a MIDI error playback error when you try to listen to what you recorded or when you try to record other tracks. It’s pointless and a complete ripoff. Save your money and buy from a different company! Their support is freaking horrible too!
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: No more noise complaints!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted and needed! I recently bought a electric guitar from a shop and knew I could play on the computer and have a lot more control and record more easily. I've been playing acoustic guitar for 13 years now and I guess I'm Bob Dylaning (for a moment). Just plug in and you can play electric without even a program running. I use Ableton 10 Suite. I used to use Garageband on my iPhone with TonerBridge with the mic on the ear buds. This is a HUGE difference and I LOVE IT! I also use bluetooth noise canceling headphones plugged into the Solo.
customer_reviews.author: IAmWhoISayIAmNot

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, but very good audio interface for use with DAWs and sample players
customer_reviews.text: A well-made product for a USB audio interface, which includes some free software and sample downloads with it. I use it only with Reason, and not the mic or external plug ins available for it. For my needs it provides great sound quality and low latency for playing sample patches in Reason and Omnisphere 2
customer_reviews.author: Dominick

customer_reviews.title: Makes everything BETTER! I'm only using it for a mic and ...
customer_reviews.text: Makes everything BETTER! I'm only using it for a mic and headset. Things have proper volume and I LOVE having physical knobs to tune and adjust. It looks sleek and performs excellently. Feels sturdy. Only issue is sometimes it doesn't like switching between itself and my speakers and it being recognized properly on Discord, resulting in a discord reset. Otherwise love it. I don't know how loud this thing expects to go though, I have it between 25-30% volume. I don't plan to blow my eardrums out!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Has issues with windows 10
customer_reviews.text: Windows 10 has some issues. if your audio has crackling from time to time ask the support for driver version 3.2.2 to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: D.

customer_reviews.title: Lasted about 7 months before it died.
customer_reviews.text: never got a whole lot of use out of the product before it decided to not cut on one day, around the 6 month mark. for the price point, sure, product was decent for that short time period. but from the get-go, the background/static noise via XLR was constantly evident - adequate gain adjustments didn't take care of this issue- and 6 months... come on. probably would NOT buy from this manufacturer again. considering the amount of market competition at this given price point, other manufacturers are offering superior products.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Gets your sounds into your DAW, no problem. What more could you want?
customer_reviews.text: Plug stuff into the front, it comes out the USB and into your favorite DAW. No drivers, no fuss, no muss. High quality construction, ultra quiet, ultra reliable. Plus, provides 48v phantom power and illuminated dial input indicators (if that ring is red, turn it down, silly). Also has Line/Inst switch, and monitor switch. I'm using the Solo's bigger brother, the 2i2, with a Sennheiser, dbx 286s, and it works so well I don't even think about it. The solo has exactly the same guts, but only for one instrument and one mike.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: The best sound I ever recorded
customer_reviews.text: I used to record directly into garageband and it never sounded that good. Now I can sing and play electric guitar and they record at the same time on separate channels. The vocals sound amazing. There is a slight pick up of the guitar strings as you strum into the mic - so I might record them separately. I am so pleased with this unit
customer_reviews.author: Swamiji — the Orange Cowboy

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality, stupid cooperator! "Pro tool first"
customer_reviews.text: The sound card is fine to me. but the software that they offer so stupid. I used the Protool first! I signed in and marked "keep me signed in", but they keep asking me relogin every week. which so annoying. Something, I forgot my password and cannot login. I have to wait for a day to reset my password. Stupid software is trying to verify login all the time, and make it annoying more than ever that I have experienced. we are your custormer, not a crime, do not asking login all the time like that.
customer_reviews.author: Imax

customer_reviews.title: Nice - easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I pair it to my Mac mini for GarageBand. I have an iris, but needed the preamp with XLR inputs for my Shure 57 mic to capture my acoustic guitar. Very nice package, and I love the headphone monitor. I run with through the USB 2 connector on my monitor which is connected in turn connected to my Mac via a USB 3 connection.
customer_reviews.author: Silicon Valley Salesguy

customer_reviews.title: Scarlett Solo - Great Interface for Beginners!
customer_reviews.text: The solo interface was very easy to install. I'm using a MAC with Garageband plus a Stennheiser e932. With the MAC there is no driver installation necessary. The Solo is excellent for input control and monitoring, really easy to set and use. So far I have downloaded the Ableton DAW. Authorization requires setup of a new account with Ableton but registration is done quickly on-line after that.
customer_reviews.author: kim

customer_reviews.title: Trash!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this back in 2017 and tried my best to figure out what happened to it, and I'm still not finding an answer. It works the way its supposed to for maybe 30-45 minutes and after about that time frame its starts making me sound like a robot. I wouldn't mind getting it refurbished or something, but I know its out of the warranty point now. So, if you're having this problem I would recommend contacting them to get it fixed ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Nollie

customer_reviews.title: great amp for an external mic
customer_reviews.text: I have it paired with an audio technia at 2020 and it is fantastic. about the size of an xbox controller. has a audio detect light built. one xlr socket, monitor mode with a 1/4 headphone jack. usb to plug directly into a pc. great for music, gamers, and content creaters if you chose not to run a mixer
customer_reviews.author: Seagrams

customer_reviews.title: It has a terrible crackling sound that just wont go away
customer_reviews.text: it works for my microphone but I can't use it for sound output. It has a terrible crackling sound that just wont go away. I've tried everything and this has happened since I purchased the unit. I've switched from using it but i've also searched online everywhere to see that others have the same problem with no fix. Don't recommend. Update: Just kept trying to redownload the drivers and restarting. Now it's flawless >.<
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Unbalance
customer_reviews.text: I'm really new to building a home studio and buying the right audio interface, the one thing I didn't like or check for was that Focusrite Scarlet Solo only had unbalance output which is RCA connection than XLR or 1/4 TRS connection
customer_reviews.author: ken-t

customer_reviews.title: For Monitors, cool. Everything else, stinks.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to use as an interface between my MacBook and Rockit monitors. It works great for that. However it does not work for recording guitar with Logic Pro X. So three stars is all it gets.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Excellent audio interface for home studio!! Works great with Rode NT1-A!!
customer_reviews.text: Great audio interface for those just getting into semi-professional/professional audio recording! Works great with Rode NT1-A!! Very easy to manipulate audio input and output levels to fit your requirements and recording environment!! For those interested in creating a home studio for recording audio, we also use Monoprice isolation shield, CBI MLC20 Low Z XLR mic cable, and a Post Audio heavy duty mic stand... highly recommend this bundle!
customer_reviews.author: Cas Kowalewski

customer_reviews.title: Very well, but I had to communicate with focusrite ...
customer_reviews.text: Very well, but I had to communicate with focusrite because I did not bring the softtube bundle when I created the focusrite account, they solved it quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo V.

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK WITH WINDOWS
customer_reviews.text: Be careful. They market this thing as Windows compatible but it does not work with Windows. Their tech support has been useless. I have searched the internet for a solution only to find that everyone with a Windows computer cannot get this thing to work. The 'works with Windows' line is nothing short of false advertising.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound Quality!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my hubby for his recording sessions and we both noticed the difference in the quality of his music in the first session! There are no more latencies while recording. It's gives him a more precise sound!! Love this product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dominique Bonner

customer_reviews.title: More than enough to make professional music
customer_reviews.text: It is way more that I expected, I upgraded to this from an IRig HD, I was happy then, now I'm super happy. Very high quality feel and look. Great team player with Studio One which Is what i use.
customer_reviews.author: jesus gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: It's just the worst. It worked for a month
customer_reviews.text: It's just the worst. It worked for a month, and now it'll work just before a stream and cut out as soon as OBS starts streaming or Audacity launches. I don't get it. Is it the software?
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: This is definitely worth your money.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent device. It works great for bringing an XLR condenser mic to my Windows pc. I used it on a Surface Pro and no problems. I highly recommend it, it's a great step toward good audio gear for recording. And the price is incredibly affordable for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Don't throw away the box, it has a bundle code for the software
customer_reviews.text: It looks cool, the volume controller is not accurate, the volume from the input devices requires microscopic adjustments for some reason, the monitor volume control is kind of bad in that regard, you can't turn the volume completely off... The support software requires you to register and even after that you have to put bunch of registration information. I didn't register it right away and surprise surprise, I lost my bundle code. I think I'll put a little bit more money into something better next time.
customer_reviews.author: Can Alper

customer_reviews.title: Some quirks, but great
customer_reviews.text: Pros +USB power and out +Mic and Instrument input +Monitor output +Looks great +Great build quality Cons +I have to unplug from PC to plug into another power source if not using PC +Doesn't work on Linux because of drivers
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good hardware, Deal-breaking software.
customer_reviews.text: Drivers are horrible for this specific device, causing crashes and corruption on several machines for me, making it almost unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin M.

customer_reviews.title: I love this audio interface
customer_reviews.text: I love this audio interface. After my other one provided too many issues(different brand), I bought this, and I haven't looked back. It's perfect, and it works will all of my games that have voice, and works with all of my VOIP programs. Also, it's not locked to the one USB port it's plugged into, so that's a big plus. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: AJH

customer_reviews.title: Waist of time and money
customer_reviews.text: Can't get the driers to work on both a Win7 and 10 machine. Complete garbage. No audio. I know my sources are all working but it does not get recognized by Windows. After countless hours going through all the help documents, this thing still doesn't work. They should change their slogan from Fast, easy to slow and frustrating. I will be returning and buying Behringer.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L. Merillat

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased to own this. Everything you receive is a fantastic add on and the product is what I expected. I wish there was a way to listen to the monitor output with a 3.5 mm jack, though. I tried using a 1/4" to 3.5 mm jack, but the audio was simply not the greatest. If you're looking to buy a somewhat cheap audio box for just and you're not using much equipment/don't mind switching it out, this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Veche

customer_reviews.title: For rap vocals get this instead of behringer umc22
customer_reviews.text: This is what I needed. It solved a lot of problems I had with mixing on the umc22. I like the umc22 and it's really good but it didn't produce the sound I wanted. This one did and worked great with the different effects I wanted to use. There are way better interfaces out there but this did what I needed and I'm thankful.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Laston

customer_reviews.title: Avoid This
customer_reviews.text: This is a nightmare. Registering multiple software. STILL can't hear my guitar out the computer speakers. Technical support is horrendous!
customer_reviews.author: Marco Blanco

customer_reviews.title: Great starter interface, wish it had a volume knob for headphone output.
customer_reviews.text: I love Focusrite products and this is no exception. The microphone preamp sounds incredible and I really think one could write an entire record on this no problem. My one issue with it (reason for the 4 stars) is that there is no separate headphone volume. Not only that, the speakers do not mute if you put your headphone on, which wouldn't be a problem if the volume control didn't affect both at the same time!
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Need mic monitoring for gaming? This is the product. Need more output volume because you have good headphones? Get a stand alone headphone amp that accepts RCA. Need to do some processing with voice like a noise gate? Get a mic preamp with those effects and plug into these inputs. Learn a little bit about audio to learns the terminology and making sure you don’t plug things into it that are amped too far and might break things.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Powell

customer_reviews.title: Well made unit ,,,,,,
customer_reviews.text: I could have gave 5 stars for the unit... small ,well made... works. That's it ! If you want to record ..I would give it 0ne star ! The software is awful.. all of it... every company. If you want to record... settle in for a mental workout.... never have i seen so many hoops to jump through.. I am sure it can done... I have done it in the past.. was hoping the software would catch up with the hardware. It hasn't.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Most Frustrating device that does not work as described.
customer_reviews.text: I have spent hours trying to make this work and now give up, I have windows 7 and this does not do anything except show that it has downloaded and nothing shows up. Anything but fast and easy! I am returning it, done with the frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Bella Beach

customer_reviews.title: When it does work correctly, it sounds great... but not for long.
customer_reviews.text: Just googling "Scarlett solo 2nd gen crackling", you'll get tons of results about how eventually (typical 1 hour for me) you will start to sound like robot on current 4.63.23.563 drivers. The current fix for this is to unplug the unit and plug it back in. UNACCEPTABLE. A little more research you will find some people have results with 3.2.2 drivers. For me when the problem would happen i wouldn't become a robot anymore, My mic volume would go through the roof! destroying any ones ears listening.
customer_reviews.author: brent darnell

customer_reviews.title: Used with the AT 2035
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that bugs me is occasionally it will disconnect from the pc and I’ll have to unglued the usb and plug it back in for it to turn on. Otherwise very solid. Edit: I’ve recently built a new computer and the disconnecting problem no longer happens.
customer_reviews.author: Don Greenwood

customer_reviews.title: Great starting audio interface for gaming/streaming
customer_reviews.text: This audio interface is great for your basic condenser microphone needs. A Dynamic mic might need a little something to get enough gain and with this unit it will be a bit quiet. No problems with drivers that I have seen, at least on Windows 10.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s good...if you love static interference
customer_reviews.text: If you look at my video you’ll have to listen a little close but you’ll sure enough hear some white noice. The product is finicky and unreliable and has only gotten worse the longer I’ve had it. Constant buzzing and clicking even without moving anything sometimes. It will also very often reset itself and completely change my core audio on logic. I’m certain the buzzing is coming from the interface since changing cords, outlets, and usbs. Definitely wouldn’t recommend this to anybody, especially because I’m sure you can get a better product for the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Bennett

customer_reviews.title: It's a great audio interface, but...
customer_reviews.text: I should have gone with the Behringer, which is half the price. Since this has only one XLR and one 1/4" input, I can't use a guitar on programs that only recognize the first channel. The Behringer uses hybrid XLR and 1/4" inputs, which seems like a better deal. Aside from that, the audio quality is great, and Ableton Live Lite 10 works really well with Amp Simulators.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Harris

customer_reviews.title: if you use it for guitar don't buy it
customer_reviews.text: the input does not have level control. your guitar output will overpower the input and clip the input. It is cheaply made. Look on the net for "clipping scarlett solo" and read away. Beware.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for YouTube content creators.
customer_reviews.text: After using this for a few YouTube videos paired with my shure pga27. The preamp is very quiet and once you install their windows drivers, it is very easy to work with. Just record with audacity and be done. Being that it’s a good preamp and very simple, this is a big winner vs a mixer for what I do.
customer_reviews.author: Zer0 Productions

customer_reviews.title: Found the interface absolutely easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Found the interface absolutely easy to use. Works with Ableton Live, Pro Tools, Amplitube 3, Reaper, and Garageband. If you're a guitarist who just needs to get his guitar riffs onto the computer, this works great.
customer_reviews.author: lennyboy

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, works well, great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Plugged in, downloaded the drivers and I was jammin'. Simple interface makes operation easy. No issues with latency. I accidently threw away the bundle code before registering so I contacted support and they responded in just a FEW MINUTES with a new one. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great! Here is why
customer_reviews.text: Great! Here is why: Pros: - Level indicators that turn red when level is too high that distorts - Phanton power - Superb DAC (even if you don't record music, listen to music/sounds through this device is so pleasant) - Build quality/Sound quality - Portable - no latency (okay surely there is a few but is not noticeable) Cons: - You can not record properly a keyboard with the Scarlett Solo (some keyboard voices that are stereo), because you don't have two line-in level inputs.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Mantilla

customer_reviews.title: The adjustable DB nob is super helpful as well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Scarlett solo to go along with my AT2035 mic for streaming. So far, its met all my needs. The adjustable DB nob is super helpful as well. Works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Sevigor

customer_reviews.title: Amazing interface to get you going!
customer_reviews.text: I used my Audio Technica M40X & Shure SM57 through it & it worked wonders! Amazing little device for the money & highly recommend it to anyone with a simple setup like mine.
customer_reviews.author: Mirrorless Adventures

customer_reviews.title: nice voice tool!
customer_reviews.text: I got this and knew immediately the gawds of Focusrite love me. This is a good little unit and everything i ever wanted to speak audio online. Please remember you need to downnload drivers to make it work. There are instructions in the box that are very clear. DON'T THROW AWAY YOUR BOX.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you're looking for something straightforward, this is the audio interface for you
customer_reviews.text: Sure is doesn't have crystal clear sound, but its quite good an completely intuitive to use. Its small and cute and does the job. I actually recorded some pretty high gain guitar parts with this thing and they sounded great before using any compression or anything. I was pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Unfortunately it only supports USB 2
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Unfortunately it only supports USB 2.0 and below. I tried using a USB 3.0 hub that was 2.0 compatible, but that crashed the hub and disconnected all devices in addition to the pops that occurred through the interface. Plugged in directly to usb 2.0 port on my mac and all is well. No power switch so you are either leaving it powered or disconnecting the usb cable.
customer_reviews.author: mh

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Audio Card
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little audio card, perfect for using with a laptop so you can take it everywhere or perfectly at home with a desktop as long as you only need a few inputs. The software that comes with it is really nice as well.
customer_reviews.author: Howie

customer_reviews.title: Hot pickups no longer a problem, no more clipping
customer_reviews.text: This unit is awesome! The main reason why I upgraded to it was because I was having a clipping issues with my previous interface due to the HI Z input not being able to handle hot pick ups recording direct. This second generation Scarlett has done away with this problem.Preamps are also very clean and my recordings have definitely inproved. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Peter R.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great on Mac
customer_reviews.text: Use Garageband with this and its great. Even comes with a handful of free software. Definitely recommend for someone trying to record. I have recorded with active guitar pickups and passive and this thing does great with both.
customer_reviews.author: Bayhas

customer_reviews.title: Low Volume Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: I followed all of the instructions, but the device did not help get appropriate volume level on Windows 10 machine. Retuned item.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Jarvis

customer_reviews.title: ... as my guitar / Ableton interface and I absolutely love it. It's very compact and hardly takes up ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this as my guitar / Ableton interface and I absolutely love it. It's very compact and hardly takes up any space in my home studio, and no problems so far! Only thing to note: buy a 1/4" to 3.5mm adapter so you can use headphones! The standard 3.5mm plug will not fit!
customer_reviews.author: Kalepa

customer_reviews.title: the most affordable and the best.
customer_reviews.text: For the money, it's the only option. Buy it now and move on to the next piece of equipment. For most mics you'll also benefit from a Simply Sound SS‐1 Microphone Preamp. Again, the most affordable and the best.
customer_reviews.author: Cayce Lynn Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great interface and great cost
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for a few months now and absolutely love it! Logic Pro X recognized and initialized with no problems and the sound quality is excellent. I run all my computer audio through it to some M-Audio speakers and it works perfectly. Great low cost audio interface for the easy musician
customer_reviews.author: Bo Beard

customer_reviews.title: Works, No Pro-tools
customer_reviews.text: The actual interface plugged an worked right away with an older computer on linux 17 MATE. Beware it doesnt come with pro-tools but it lets you link up accounts with the company that makes pro-tools where you have to make an account and you get the FREE version of pro-tools which is very limited and you can get now without this interface. So it doesnt really come with pro-tools, its misleading
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Does what we need for great audio stream
customer_reviews.text: We use this in place of an iRig HD. Live audio goes from a digital mixer to our MacBook and we use OBS to Livestream video to YouTube. Just need to adjust timing to 70ms for audio and video sync. Flawless otherwise and well built.
customer_reviews.author: the_arrow

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: this was recommended to me by a colleague to advance audio recordings and he was right I enjoy this product thoroughly and I would definitely buy again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong if you Focusrite
customer_reviews.text: Nice and compact with great features and sturdy build. I've had zero problems to date. The sound is good, no latency problems or anything. I recommend for the mobile musician or singer songwriter.
customer_reviews.author: R San Agustin

customer_reviews.title: This is the to go! Audio sounds incredible!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best experiences I ever had with audio equioment. So small and so much power and control for a first time music producer. Purchased after a deadmou5 master class. Very much needed and jam packed with a butt load of software and support. New to USB audio. This is the way to go!
customer_reviews.author: Leah Shields

customer_reviews.title: Focus Right Away For Your DAW
customer_reviews.text: Focusrite rules! Nothing difficult about installation as long as you get the current drivers from the website. Input and output are quality.
customer_reviews.author: Maestro

customer_reviews.title: The device is great but protools doesn’t have a save in control
customer_reviews.text: The device works great but I’m really disappointed with protools first that came with it cuz it doesn’t have a save in control which allows you to export your project on protools to get them mixed and mastered. I was really disappointed with that because it’s the only reason I bought Focusrite Scarlett. All I wanted was a protools I could use and save my project to send to other producers to mix them. But Focusrite works great
customer_reviews.author: arthur

customer_reviews.title: it's an awesome mixer  Was the 1st microphone to USB mixer I used
customer_reviews.text: Creates a authentic microphone or instrument sound through A USB cable with active monitoring Windows has released updates that have made a malfunction making my voice sound like a robot. I didn't know how to fix it it didn't seem like it was an easy task.
customer_reviews.author: SPEARS711

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: It took a bit of time to figure out how to use this as a beginner; but now I'm perfectly happy with it. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler The Guy Dude

customer_reviews.title: I use this all of the time now to play ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this all of the time now to play guitar on my computer. I am practicing more than ever so thanks for that.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Rouse

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, prompt delivery!
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a great interface for a home studio hobbyist like me. The sound is clean, with both the guitar input and the mic input. I have paired it with an AKG Project Studio 220 mic and I was very pleasantly surprised by the results. The included software download licenses provide a great way to get off and running with your recording fun. Delivery was fast, too. Overall, I am quite happy with my purchase. I may consider an upgrade to a larger Scarlett product in the future, but this one is fine for now and has been a great starting point.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this is so much better than using a simple headset mic
customer_reviews.text: This is my 1st ever "professional" audio item (paired with my AT2020) and wow, this is so much better than using a simple headset mic. I had a bit of trouble making it work at first, turned out I got the wrong driver. Whoops, my bad. I contacted Focusrite support and they were simply amazing. Their responses were fast and helped me get this working very fast! I would highly reccomend this for single input audio for things like streaming and YouTube any day of the week! I will try to remember to post an update on this once I get my Sennheiser HD 598 Special Edition in sometime tomorrow (as of 7/29/16).
customer_reviews.author: Dusk

customer_reviews.title: Works great, sounds great for voice over
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't get Pro Tools First to work, but I use Audacity anyway and this thing was basically plug and play with it. This voice actor is very satisfied with its ease of use and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Revan_Deschain

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: It works seamlessly with Garage Band & my MacBook Pro (2018?) . No latency. Just plug and play/record.
customer_reviews.author: CeCe

customer_reviews.title: The reputation around these exists for a reason. For ...
customer_reviews.text: The reputation around these exists for a reason. For the price - it’s hard to beat how well it works.
customer_reviews.author: Alex H.

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, Excellent Quality!
customer_reviews.text: My husband does voice acting and I had bought him this. He loves it! Easy to use and definitely helps!! If your an aspiring voice actor I would definitely recommend this!! Affordable and excellent quality!
customer_reviews.author: GundamAsh

customer_reviews.title: Nice and easy
customer_reviews.text: Worked right of the box. It's been a big help on an older machine that I use for a livestream. Looking forward to using it in other projects
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Have issues with static electricity? Don't get this.
customer_reviews.text: If you don't ever have issues with static in your house, then you're probably fine. I have a cat that picks up lots of static electricity in the winter, and she accidentally deposits that static into this DAC. There doesn't seem to be any mitigation to bleed out that static and it interferes with my XLR mic until I unplug the DAC and replug it in.
customer_reviews.author: Zach N

customer_reviews.title: Full Audio UPGRADE!
customer_reviews.text: Needed an audio upgrade for my computer and phew the Scarlett Solo came in clutch! Great sound out put, monitor and xlr handling, everything sounds better, it even pushed me to get studio monitors(versus just headset).
customer_reviews.author: Groat

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Was an okay device. It looks really pretty but the software included is VERY limiting. Functions how it should. I had an issue with line in connections but it could of been my own cables which were new as well.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Joseph Monte

customer_reviews.title: Works great and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my Windows 10 machine. Super easy instructions to go to the website and download/install the drivers and off you go. The knobs feel very quality and it seems really well made. Glad to have a decent audio interface again.
customer_reviews.author: dexter holliday

product_meta.title: Focusrite Scarlett Solo (2nd Gen) USB Audio Interface with Pro Tools | First
product_meta.description: Focus rite's second generation Scarlett solo is ideal if you want to start recording, and now it's even better, faster and easier than before. Though compact and easy to use, it still delivers the same class-leading sound quality and digital conversion as the rest of the latest Scarlett range. It has a single natural sounding Scarlett mica preamp, a newly-designed instrument input and super-low latency*. take it anywhere, connect by a single USB cable to a computer, plug your microphone and instrument straight in, and easily record studio quality Audio. Focus rite is the perfect partner for Pro Tools. To celebrate this Scarlett solo now comes with an exclusive version of Pro Tools | first focus rite creative pack, as well as able ton Live Lite. It is compatible with all major DAWs, on Mac and PC. *Super-low round-trip latency was measured at 2. 74ms, working at 96kHz with a 32 samples buffer on Logic Pro x, running on a mac Pro and os 10. 11.
feature_bullets: One natural-sounding Scarlett mic preamp with plenty of even gain; one instrument input, Stereo line outputs on RCA phono for connecting to home speakers; one headphones output with gain control. You don't need a power supply, either - just connect with a USB cable and start recording.
Class-leading conversion and sample rates up to 192kHz / 24 bit; super-low latency for using your plug-ins in real time without the need for DSP
LIMITED TIME OFFER: FREE Venomode DeeQ, Maximal 2, and Pivot, plug-ins upon registration and download.

Includes Pro Tools | First Focusrite Creative Pack and Ableton Live Lite, Softube Time and Tone Bundle, Focusrite’s Red Plug-in Suite, 2GB of Loopmasters samples, Choice of one free XLN Addictive Keys virtual instrument, all available via download upon purchase and registration

Compatible with Windows 7 and higher, and Mac OS X 10.10 and higher. Frequency Response: 20 Hz - 20 kHz ± 0.25dB. Supported sample rates: 44.1 kHz, 48 kHz, 88.2 kHz, 96 kHz, 176.4 kHz, 192 kHz; Headphone Dynamic Range:104dB (A-weighted). Focusrite now offers a 3-Year Warranty on this and all other Focusrite products.
